summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Marion Street, from First Avenue to Second Avenue, all in the City of Seattle, by paving the same with sandstone blocks, laid upon proper concrete foundation, together with granite curbs and all necessary catch basins, and sewer construction, in accordance with Resolution No. 907, of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899.
